title: Has The Great British Bake Off had its day?
text:
The show has seen viewing figures fall this year (Picture: Love Productions / Channel 4 / Mark Bourdillon)

The Great British Bake Off’s tenth series ended last night with a surprise victory for baker David Atherton, but as the dust settles on his controversial victory, is it time to admit that Bake Off has had its day?

With an analysis of both the viewing figures for this series and the amount of tweets each episode has gone steadily down year-on-year since the baking show de-camped to Channel 4, it’s true that Bake Off isn’t the must-see TV it once was.

After last night’s final, journalist Scott Bryan handily pointed out that the number of viewers tuning into the show has actually halved since the show’s peak in 2015, when Nadiya Hussain took the trophy.

The first Channel 4 Bake Off series final got 7.3 million viewers. The final of the last BBC series got more than 14 million viewers. Nadiya’s 2015 win: peak of 14.5 million. https://t.co/tP3Pyxr77j — Scott Bryan (@scottygb) October 30, 2019

Viewing figures have even fallen since the baking show’s debut on Channel 4 – its first run on the channel logged 7.3 million viewers for its final, whilst last night’s bagged 6.9 million. Those numbers are still a world away from the giddy heights of 2015, where a massive 14.5 million viewers tuned in.

New research from Vanquis has also uncovered that the number of tweets generated by each episode of Bake Off has actually gone down this year.

An analysis of some 8.2 million tweets found that series nine of the show on average saw 65,830 tweets per episode, whilst this years run has seen that number tumble to 50,804.

The apparent fall in viewers and social engagement, however, didn’t stop fans kicking off because of last night’s finale results. David’s victory came as something of a surprise given that he had never won Star Baker.

Runner-up Steph Blackwell had previously won Star Baker for a record number of consecutive weeks, so her victory seemed almost assured.

There was a backlash against his win, and David has finally broken his silence after fans accused Steph of being ‘robbed.’

The Great British Bake Off will return in 2020.
